document.title: INDIANA ACADEMIC STANDARDS World Languages American Sign Language: Secondary (ASL) 2019

AC982FF5083543269E710724BB01B7B4.description: I can plan real or imaginary travel, events, and forums.

AEFD057AB1664E929F928C514AF15BD3.description: I can act participate as a volunteer or mentor to a younger learner of ASL.

74C49E16D86246C1ABC73A46602B9CF6.description: I can attend cultural events or social activities that reflect Deaf culture.

921A531C66C64FEC82099EE999E41226.description: I can attend cultural events or social activities that reflect Deaf culture.

D4BF10C7A05E4D05A8D62ADADA8FF243.description:
I can engage in activities related to personal interests gained from exposure to
ASL and interact with Deaf culture.

0193586E42C0434ABC018B7AD1422873.description: I can establish and/or maintain interpersonal relationships with ASL users.

DDADB01EEE0E409BB5DACD3E91ACBF95.description: I can exchange information about topics of personal interest with ASL users.

6B29D068F6054421BF967509B3447A34.description: I can view materials and/or use media in ASL for enjoyment or personal growth.

263A8FD23B8145BA849D7FB375ECD385.description: I can attend a children’s play, puppet show, or storytelling presented in ASL.

30F8E440948C46FA9FF7CB8AB169B916.description: I can study the significance of Martha’s Vineyard in the Deaf history.

85E3FC440D4A46B3AD02EBFFAA7093FF.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Intermediate - I can use ASL both within and beyond the classroom to
interact and learn in the Deaf community and in the globalized world.

9B64A6E15F1A4CDFA3A57F645B23B7C5.description:
Lifelong Learning - Learners show evidence of becoming lifelong learners by
using American Sign Language for personal enjoyment and enrichment.

AAC1DE5C26A641DBBDA65455A53585F1.description: I can give a performance in ASL at a school or community event.

BD72C1545D284272BB9B6A6F9C3A858B.description:
I can participate in school-to-work projects or career-exploration activities in
fields that require proficiency in ASL.

99035BE02291494D94AF58920225C803.description:
I can use ASL to interact with or help Deaf newcomers to the school and
community.

99D4EB9847BC4CEDA619BB9A4AE00341.description:
I can use ASL to communicate with members of the Deaf community about
personal interests or community and world events.

CD234ACCAC5845CABDCFAED8F5CA14B8.description:
I can invite community members to participate in ASL or Deaf-relatedschool
events.

5F1A4FA01A7F42EAA4F995CC2F608CE1.description:
I can use ASL to participate in the Deaf community activities and projects with
Deaf people outside of school.

0F4BE0D91A044F629EB3EFB1977BEFDC.description: I can use ASL to plan activities that benefit the school or community.

5A7E6C6E0A05474DB0F1B78DFD1C947E.description:
I can use ASL to communicate with members of the Deaf community about daily
life, various experiences, and special events.

28904CF2D1B74D2387C27F1CA10E4A5E.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Intermediate - I can use ASL language both within and beyond the classroom
to interact and collaborate in the Deaf community.

B33263FA52D2425195142F6E8E42888D.description:
School and Global - Learners use American Sign Language within and beyond
the school setting.

53E9548CE282454C9E450E7661FC0F33.description:
Communicate and interact with cultural competence in order to participate in
multilingual communities at home and around the world.

8FA13938ACF647D5B23BA3A7D6E1A226.description:
I can hypothesize about the relationship between perspectives and practices in
Deaf culture and compare these with similar relationships from their own culture.

4BFD3BC1F1D54CC9A5B00E4FCC2211D0.description:
I can compare and analyze the cultural nuances of meaning in words,
expressions, idioms, and figurative language in ASL and English, or other spoken languages.

7B72F8F62BB94806A129A2817A240117.description:
I can develop an understanding of the use of rhythm and instrumentation usedin
Deaf performances.

091AD0BA069B4F4499BADC917B8F0D90.description:
I can examine the relationship between cultural perspectives and products by
analyzing selected products from Deaf culture and their own.

BC2FDCE1C80741D7B54C79C0B1F98A1A.description:
I can examine the relationship between cultural perspectives and practices, such
as celebrations, work habits, and entertainment by analyzing selected practices from Deaf
culture and their own culture.

AF5C6882B901439FB62CF6A5868EFCF8.description:
I can discuss that I have a culture, by comparing sample daily activities in Deaf
culture and their own.

460AB8D4B2264BDB857D8857087A1BBC.description:
I can contrast verbal and nonverbal behavior within particular activities among
friends, classmates, family members, and teachers in Deaf culture and their own culture.

DFD778CF20B54312AD59F5DA4A8855ED.description:
I can identify the similarities and differences between traditional schools for the
Deaf and their own, and compare their family life with other Deaf families.

405E579C2ECE4466832DFA73DDD9B292.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Intermediate - I can explain and provide universal details about differences and
similarities between American Deaf culture, American Culture, and other signed languages - countries’
cultures.

EBE4727209574A6DB2C0312452E2A5FB.description:
Language Comparisons - Learners discuss the nature of language through
comparisons of American Sign Languages and other languages.

18B804A4A6DE41D685694F37ECD9B962.description:
I can analyze elements of ASL, such as time and tense formation, and compare
them to linguistic elements in English.

CF3F96D1AE05443CAD4582018792D72C.description:
I can analyze and explain visual basis of ASL influences meaning, with the implication that many words, phrases, idioms, and figurative expressions do not translate
directly from one language into another and vice versa.

1CD316D9AAFA4A899719F2E0025E7AD2.description:
I can recognize that lexicalized signs undergo changes in meaning and form in
ASL.

E861EE0D68904D58A1D7A80D1ADE31B3.description: I can analyze different categories of depicting verbs and classifiers used in ASL.

249008B291934D26BF936825E90FE56D.description: I can compare the temporal aspects of ASL and English.

E06B2293704545D9A8C472D825AE586F.description:
I can recognize and explain the differences and similarities in word order, verb
formation, and nouns in ASL and English.

192E5664AD1E4274A30D819233182EE4.description:
I can recognize and correctlyuse the non-manual signals that are distinctive to
ASL.

71A889CF941443C4A86649E63F2C1C55.description:
I can discuss ways to express respect and communicate status differences in
ASL and English.

F0FBFD6489B84F708212014EB137A92B.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Intermediate - I can provide universal details about differences and similarities
between ASL, English, and other signed languages (from other countries).

DB16A32E1F734B8B8018662A164B0405.description:
Cultural Comparisons – Learners discuss the nature of culture through
comparisons of American Deaf culture, American culture, and other signed languages (countries’
cultures).

93A0DE27058E4FA3864D5EAAEDA303B2.description:
Develop insight into the nature of language and culture in order to interact with
cultural competence.

CDB22EF17A4B42B4ACC1E34831146ABE.description:
I can observe and analyze common themes in ASL literature that
include differences between how Deaf individuals view themselves and are viewed
by hearing people.

3A489599EC994017803C28528B8227D9.description:
I can analyze and compare the perspectives of the two dominant philosophies of
educating the Deaf and its effects on the Deaf worldview.

92A939A326FC4DE09C66207359270587.description:
I can analyze and explain the context of major milestones in Deaf history, such as
how those events have influenced, and continue to sustain the concept of Deaf pride.

D23AB490D78949C9AAD77057F8D9A8E5.description:
I can draw a variety of sources intended for native ASL users of their age to
explain the concept of Deaf-Gain.

7DAC6602EDDA407A84F6545BC3DE4259.description:
I can obtain information and viewpoints available through ASL or Deafrelated media, compare it with information on the same topic in English, and analyze
the different perspectives and/or bias shown in the sources.

723D73AB611B47D0B92B3BC5FE96F40E.description:
I can recognize and am able to explain the viewpoint of each of the labels
traditionally applied to the Deaf.

9AD071AE4BC14813916991C883C77FF8.description:
I can research and explain major events in Deaf history that have had a profound
influence on Deaf culture.

7DEEB2B2931F43678BA17D36E760C79C.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Intermediate - I can access and evaluate more complex information and
perspectives that are available through ASL and Deaf culture.

A8562958D7E24B2296B4FC49680B9F6B.description:
Making Connections - Learners acquire information and recognize the
distinctive viewpoints that are only available through American Sign Language and Deaf culture.

5A6D18ABAB7F49D899E643168E3BE55D.description:
I am able to include information from other school subjects with information
available in ASL to complete activities in the ASL classroom.

903CF67E81B4441EBF348CE25C8CDDC5.description:
I can present reports in ASL on topics being studied in different subjects (history,
math, science, and so forth).

79EB559EDAE94CD8B113DF3C7B5AEAE1.description:
I can research and present relevant events in the Deaf events related to world
history, politics, and economics.

62DEEE63C8F74A45AC89791FE7296B3F.description: I can exchange views in ASL on topics from other content classes.

849AE74D3719437188D69F62774A9394.description:
I can describe significant contributions of Deaf Americans to history, the
arts, sciences, literature and other fields.

CBE63699DCB44311BD7D1FACA9B9104D.description:
I can present the facts related to the study of world history that is associated with
the history of the Deaf events.

8507D4D373E14EBB92DA702639E2A8B3.description:
I can expand my knowledge in other subject areas by conducting a research on
topics of personal interests and give a presentation on it.

40B3B59DCFC24C30AA1D7AD14916F1A8.description: I can present live or recorded reports in ASL on topics.

7CBFDE9A104C41DD9B5DB634120A2871.description:
I can view and discuss short videos in ASL related to other disciplines such as
social studies, science, technology, and the arts.

094F9661C08447FCBC0FAED487B4D787.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Intermediate - I can access and evaluate more complex information and
perspectives that are available through the ASL and its culture.

F19C78F725014FE9A3B5D9B5F06C57F1.description:
Acquiring Information and Diverse Perspectives - Learners reinforce and
further their knowledge of other disciplines through American Sign Language.

478A3304860545609332274D10592DD1.description:
Connect with other disciplines and acquire information and diverse perspectives in
order to use the language to function academic and career-related situations.

DB3EECD904344B38B32EFB15343C5D48.description:
Students interact in a culturally appropriate manner with Deaf people of
various backgrounds in a variety of contexts.

49E3EBECB44A4E53A74F0B33B21B218F.description:
I can discuss my experiences by participating in activities enjoyed by young
Deaf adults, such as games, sports, ASL music, and entertainment.

10D92FC9DB754892B5E3677CA4C565FD.description:
I can identify, analyze, and discuss sub-groups in the Deaf community and their
themes, ideas, and perspectives.

07025F02A24D464F9E0A6F1540DC9CE9.description:
I can identify and explain about expressive products of Deaf culture, such as
stories, poetry, art, and literature, and explore the way in which these products reflect the
lifestyles and perspectives of Deaf people.

606F007BF8964335916CC82425BF5035.description:
I can investigate and discuss the different geographical environments in which
Deaf people live and examine the impact of these environments on the lifestyles of various
Deaf people.

3FDBDECF5B184DEEB9245906AF79CC98.description:
I can recognize and explain themes, ideas, or perspectives of the Deaf people and
recognize how they are reflected by the culture.

36860E6767894672A8E27C684F9CDC38.description:
I can identify and explain different elements involved in tangible products of the
Deaf culture.

790C4DA2962748D4B120913A345FEC1E.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - In my own and other cultures, I can identify products and practices to help me
understand perspectives in the Deaf culture and in the Deaf community.

F391C61A46644F6BA30D53FEB304D173.description:
Relating Cultural Practices and Products to Perspectives (Investigate)-
Learners provide an explanation of the relationship between the products and perspectives of American
Deaf culture.

2907CD09105943BEA3B06D6D8AB1CE22.description:
I can use acquired knowledge of Deaf culture to interact in a culturally
appropriate manner with Deaf people in a variety of contexts.

8DC5FF29CC914DB787164A51ED10997E.description:
I can research and explain the common pattern of resistance to, acceptance
of, and eventual self- identification within Deaf culture as experienced by the majority of
Deaf people.

B83053020BA04CE8B0688E112F5919E7.description:
I can analyze and discuss social, political, and educational institutions
and their influences on the culture of Deaf people and related issues.

DC4A3E4DC39842DAAD041CBE357A025B.description:
I can discuss and participate in activities enjoyed by Deaf teenagers, such
as sports, dance, games, and entertainment, and examine the social norms that underlie
these activities.

3D47E65D292F4FAD93F08C2B468BFC06.description:
I can investigate and discuss aspects of American Deaf culture that are
handed down from generation to generation.

C61612AC096146BFB4A742DD9A268500.description:
I can discuss various communication strategies used by Deaf people in their
daily lives.

EB743B5E42404B14ACAEA743353C47FC.description: Proficiency Benchmark: Intermediate - I can interact at a functional level in familiar contexts.

63A1BBF7F96D4191B08206AABB29EE8F.description:
Relating to Other Cultures by Interacting - Learners provide an explanation of
the relationship between the practices and perspectives of American Deaf culture.

D6054FC41EC2479DBAE8F190D06793BE.description: Interact with cultural competence and understanding.

5FCC247074044D64B983D91F1989707E.description: I can select and use signs are modified with inflections.

7A155F74A22A4B3AAD2AA4C434FE2B03.description:
I can express preferences and feelings about information they have gathered about
events, experiences, everyday activities and other school subjects.

AE76D466D16B40B39C80B7EAA800222C.description:
I can create recorded messages on topics of personal interest, school routines, and
community events.

0B5D838015934FF28C5011E1FC492981.description:
I can present skits, recite selected poems, tell anecdotes, and perform stories in
ASL for school events.

5107A13A4A10498384D06C04EFAB923C.description: I can analyze and compare the meaning of selected classifiers.

A7CCF2B80A8D4159AE70BCAB73A29BF0.description:
I can identify the parameters of ASL, including handshape, location, movement,
palm orientation, and non-manual signals.

5B97AA1463254E1DAACEB679E4D2A5B3.description: I can analyze and explain the meaning of selected classifiers.

906F8CD6ED3B4C3B943F48A7AE3E9D50.description: I can discuss familiar ASL stories, fairy tales, or poems.

B76A3FBA90FE41D7855CC3E70377778F.description:
I can use ASL to tell peers in or out of school about their own cultures or cultural
products and practices.

13DB973E8F654BD9AEC6132CCFA19CB2.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can present information on both very familiar and everyday topics
using a variety of practiced or memorized vocabulary, and simple phrases in ASL.

8944BA04781E49D190128F9AFFC1E35E.description:
Presentational: Students present information, concepts, and ideas to an
audience of viewers in American Sign Language.

E5EB96D0EA8F4FC0A86F72D1F6ADF808.description:
I can analyze and discuss the main plot, subplot, characters, physical
descriptions, and meaning in authentic literary materials.

73584E28C4C24704A799A22EFFFA00AF.description:
I can explain the cultural nuances of meaning in expressive products used in the
Deaf community, including ASL literature and the visual arts.

5439E694E63B491AB34A2DDD66F1F916.description:
I can identify the levels of register in live and recorded contexts and explain their
significance.

B6DD4BD315584A28AB4688861263EDCA.description:
I can use knowledge acquired in other settings and from other subject areas to
interpret live and recorded messages in ASL.

CC5CD2D98BB74412BA36BABA0D1353BF.description:
I can interpret and explain announcements, information, and messages related
to daily activities and other school subjects.

704E34A4921541D78D49D2554FF2388E.description:
I can identify and discuss the main ideas in age-appropriate ASL narratives and
stories.

D94683A6B18F4C80AE41441BCFBED8AA.description:
I can identify gestures, facial expressions, non-manual signals, and other visual
cues.

7D9EA694DE164A3896D676D781169141.description: I can identify and retell the principal characters and/or events and details in age-appropriate ASL literature, including poetry and narratives.

9CD057AFA8444AFF89DCA99F337809D0.description: I can identify the main ideas or themes from live or recorded material on topics of personal interest

3A51A2A6BE394B67B84979BD3371482B.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Novice - I can identify the general topic and basic information in both
familiar and everyday contexts by recognizing practiced or memorized vocabulary or simple phrases
signed in ASL.

137413737DFA457DB183D631E2428D90.description:
Interpretive: Learners comprehend and interpret live and recorded American
Sign Language on a variety of topics.

54D3E731B96E4E0AA052E77A2AA4A2EC.description:
I can share their personal reactions to selected ASL literature, such as poems,
plays, and personal narratives.

2E468CC5A06648DEA131FFC5EF886BFD.description: I can use ASL to obtain Deaf-related resources, products and services.

9FC8F8904BE54353B2C4F79BC3D603AF.description:
I can communicate in a range of formal and informal scenarios using contextually
appropriate linguistic and cultural behaviors.

1C615FC6403448809DDF451FC6760A85.description:
I can visit ASL vlogs to identify contemporary issues in the Deaf community and
discuss its importance and relevance with the members.

493C9ABC172942E68B4D5BD88D533209.description:
I can communicate with Deaf people, from the local community, and/or school to
identify similarities and differences in education, family, home life, recreation, and activities.

2728C9DFA0DE427BBCC924C662C8A8C2.description:
I can use ASL to discuss matters of personal importance, such as memorable
experiences, important life events, and ambitions for the future.

944F16696E624F3B82F59F70AC8A8138.description: I can role-play a variety of situations and scenarios.

F69897C82B5347BD9F395D947E86A22D.description:
I can recognize art and technology created by Deaf members within the Deaf
community (i.e., pagers, alarm clocks, doorbells, smoke alarms), and share opinions.

0DE3BD6C4C844B0592FC9BB7F87482A4.description:
Proficiency Benchmark: Intermediate - I can participate in conversations in ASL on familiar topics, creating
sentences and a series of sentences that ask and answer a variety of questions.

553A8E871DCC4830A9017A3F932963A6.description:
Interpersonal: Learners use American Sign Language to engage in conversation
provide information, express feelings and emotions, and exchange opinions.

013BFD11A4114AB696EAE31EA2A7AEA3.description:
Communicate effectively in more than one language in order to function in a
variety of situations and for multiple purposes.
